IdleDetector.summary: NOTE Experimental The IdleDetector interface of the provides methods and events for detecting user activity on a device or screen.

remarks.para: This interface requires a secure context.

IdleDetectorRequestPermission.summary:
NOTE Experimental The requestPermission() static method of the
interface returns a that resolves with a string when the user has chosen
whether to grant the origin access to their idle state. Resolves with
"granted" on acceptance and "denied" on refusal.
IdleDetectorRequestPermission.returns: A Promise that resolves with "granted" or "denied".

IdleDetectorScreenState.summary:
NOTE Experimental The screenState read-only property of the interface
returns a string indicating whether the screen is locked, one of "locked" or
"unlocked".
IdleDetectorScreenState.value: Either "locked" or "unlocked" if has been called, or null otherwise.

IdleDetectorUserState.summary: NOTE Experimental The userState read-only property of the interface returns a string indicating whether the user has interacted with the device since the call to start().
IdleDetectorUserState.value: Either "active" or "idle" if has been called, or null otherwise.

IdleDetectorStart.summary:
NOTE Experimental The start() method of the interface returns a
that resolves when the detector starts listening for changes in the
user's idle state. This
method takes an optional options object with the threshold in milliseconds
where inactivity should be reported and signal for an AbortSignal to abort
the idle detector.

IdleDetectorChange.summary: NOTE Experimental The change event of the interface fires when the value of userState or screenState has changed.

IdleDetectorIdleDetector.summary:
NOTE Experimental The IdleDetector() constructor creates a new
object which provides events indicating when the user is no longer interacting
with their device or the screen has locked.
